v.
The HALIFAX COUNTY BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS 338A17-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. February 8, 2018 Mark Dorosin, Attorney at Law, Elizabeth Haddix, Attorney at Law, Pittsboro, Eileen O'Connor, Attorney at Law, Allen Buansi, Attorney at Law, for Silver, LaTonya, et al.

Brent Ducharme, Attorney at Law.

Garris Neil Yarborough, Attorney at Law, Fayetteville, Glynn Rollins, Attorney at Law, Roanoke Rpds, for The Halifax County Board Of Commissioners. K. Ricky Watson, Jr., Co-Director of Youth Justice Project, Peggy Nicholson, Attorney at Law, Jennifer Story, Attorney at Law, Jane Wettach, Attorney at Law, Celia Pistolis, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Aisha Oni Forte, Attorney at Law, for Children's Law Clinic at Duke Law School, et al.

Seth Ascher

Jennifer W. Marsh, Director of Research.

S. Luke Largess, Attorney at Law, Cheyenne Chambers, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for N.C. Advocates for Justice. Beth Tyner Jones, Attorney at Law, Rebecca C. Fleishman, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Matthew Tilley, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for NCACC.

George Hausen, Jr., Legal Aid.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 7th of February 2018 by North Carolina Association of County Commissioners for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 8th of February 2018."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
